title: LongWriter-V: Enabling Ultra-Long and High-Fidelity Generation in Vision-Language Models
author: Shangqing Tu (Tsinghua University), Yucheng Wang (Tsinghua University), Daniel Zhang-Li (Tsinghua University), Yushi Bai (Tsinghua University), Jifan Yu (Tsinghua University), Yuhao Wu (Singapore University of Technology and Design), Lei Hou (Tsinghua University), Hui-Qin Liu (Tsinghua University), Zhiyuan Liu (Tsinghua University), Bin Xu (Tsinghua University), Juanzi Li (Tsinghua University)
relevance_why: The proposed methods for generating long outputs and enhancing data relevance could inspire similar approaches in audio generation, particularly in creating long-form audio narratives or music compositions based on visual prompts.
background: Enhancing the ability of models to generate comprehensive text based on visual inputs, exceeding previous limitations of 1,000 words in generated text outputs.
contribution: LongWriter-V introduces a structured fine-tuning dataset and an innovative preference optimization technique to improve long-output generation, achieving coherent text exceeding 3,000 words.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous models generally limit output to around 1,000 words and struggle with coherence in long texts due to insufficient training on long-output examples.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work enhances fine-tuning by integrating segmented outputs and iterative human feedback to enhance long-text fidelity and length.

key_innovation: Utilizing a two-stage process for long output generation that combines planning with corrective human feedback to ensure high-quality outputs.
real_world_impact: This research could significantly improve applications in automated content generation, such as creative writing and detailed reporting, allowing for richer user experiences across various domains.
limitations: The dataset size may not fully capture the diversity of long-output tasks, limiting generalizability.

new_terms.LongWriter-V: **LongWriter-V** refers to a framework designed to enhance long-output generation capabilities in vision-language models through innovative fine-tuning techniques.
new_terms.Direct Preference Optimization (DPO): **Direct Preference Optimization** is a method that enhances model outputs by leveraging user feedback to differentiate preferred outputs from less desirable ones in a training context.

open_sourcing: The dataset and code are available at https://github.com/THU-KEG/LongWriter-V
